title: What is the importance of the Great Awakening? - Quora

response.answer_text: The great awakening is a term used by evangelical christians to describe the religious revival in pre revolutionary America associated with preachers like Jonathon Edwards. Prior to this Americans were not particularly oriented to Christian faith, despite some original' Puritan 'settlers, and the intelligentsia had been infected with Enlightenment Deism and unbelief. Afterwards although these effects played a large part in American life with Franklin and Paine and a secular influx, what was to become the USA was set on the way to being the majority Christian nation it is today.
